page.title: 01BADLUARACH/SCORAIG
page.content: LITTLE LOCH BROOM IS THE DIVIDING LINE AND THE LINK BETWEEN THE TWO CONTRASTING CROFTING COMMUNITIES OF BADLUARACH AND SCORAIG,EACH SITUATED NEAR THE TIP OF ITS OWN PENINSULA.THE GEOLOGY AND RESULTING WILDLIFE ON EACH SIDE IS SIMILAR,BUT BADLUARACH,FACING NORTH,HAS LESS SUNSHINE,WHILE SCORAIG IS OPEN TO THE PREVAILING S.W WIND. BADLUARACH,AT THE END OF 4km SINGLE- TRACK ROAD,CONSISTS OF 9 CROFT HOUSES, HALF OF WHICH ARE OCCUPIED BY PEOPLE BELONGING TO THE AREA.SCORAIG,REACHED ONLY BY SEA,OR AN 8km FOOTPATH,IS PEOPLED ENTIRELY BY INCOMERS.THE AGE RANGE IN BADLUARACH IS FROM MID-TEEN TO MID-EIGHTIES;IN SCORAIG,FROM INFANT TO MID-FIFTIES. THE BADLUARACH JETTY IS USED MOSTLY BY THE PEOPLE OF SCORAIG AS THEIR LINK WITH THE ROAD;AND THE SCORAIG JETTY IS THE USUAL ACCESS TO SCORAIG.
